title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 October 2015 - XWiki
content:

08:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <vmassol> good morning  
08:19 <vmassol> still plenty of problems on ci :(  
08:19 <vmassol> the import tests fail at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-administration-test-tests/2057/testReport/  
08:19 <tmortagne> yes  
08:20 <tmortagne> most of the remaining failing have been caused by last commits from what I can see...  
08:20 <vmassol> 12 failing in platform  
08:20 <tmortagne> will have to wait for mflorea  
08:20 <vmassol> 18 in -ui  
08:21 <tmortagne> the import one might come from XWIKI-12734  
08:21 <tmortagne> \*ones  
08:21 <vmassol> yes  
08:25 <cjd> has quit  
08:29 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <tmortagne> mflorea also still need to work on AWM and class app refactoring failures

09:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <gdelhumeau> Hi  
09:33 <vmassol> hi gdelhumeau  
09:34 <gdelhumeau> any idea why $services.icon is not bundled anymore in flamingo-skin-tests ?  
09:34 <vmassol> no idea  
09:44 <gdelhumeau> hmm actually it is bundled  
09:45 <gdelhumeau> no it's not  
09:45 <vmassol> :)  
09:56 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: your trees are not displayed when the breadcrulb is expanded  
09:59 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: maybe I should trigger an event when the breadcrumb is expanded  
09:59 <mflorea> ok, I'll check  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: and you listen to this  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> WDYT?  
10:01 <mflorea> xwiki:dom:updated would be nice  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> nothing more specific?  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> xwiki:breadcrumb:updated or xwiki:breadcrumb:expanded ?  
10:03 <gdelhumeau> or xwiki:hierarchy:updated or xwiki:hierarchy:expanded ?  
10:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <ClemensR> has quit  
10:11 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <mflorea> why does it have to be specific. xwiki:dom:updated is already used and known  
10:22 <tmortagne> mflorea: looks like one of your commits from yesterday caused issue with import UI, or maybe it was related to Enygma's changes  
10:23 <tmortagne> from what I see in the screenshot tree used to be fully selected by default and is unselected by default now  
10:23 <mflorea> I don't see how my changes could have affected the import tree but I'll check  
10:32 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <tmortagne> as far as I can see the issue is that xtree.check\_all() is not doing anything (I can see it's called but it as no effect)  
10:36 <tmortagne> Enygma`: could be related to your changes around document tree maybe  
10:36 <tmortagne> (talking about failing import UI tests)  
10:42 <tmortagne> there is no error and the method exist so not sure what is wrong  
10:42 <Enygma`> tmortagne: you mean in the pageobjects?  
10:42 <tmortagne> Enygma`: the import UI is broken  
10:42 <tmortagne> you can't select all pages anymore  
10:43 <tmortagne> and that's what cause the failing tests (since the test expect all the pages to be selected by default)  
10:44 <Enygma`> are you using the documentTree macro in import or the tree macro?  
10:45 <tmortagne> the import UI is a template  
10:46 <Enygma`> right, so you are using the tree widget, building the html  
10:46 <tmortagne> yes  
10:46 <Enygma`> my change moved the documentTree macro around, so I`m not sure why it should impact you  
10:46 <Enygma`> on the other hand, mflorea recently introduced the tree navigator in the breadcrumb  
10:47 <Enygma`> this introduces more than one tree in the same page (breadcrumbs + import)  
10:47 <tmortagne> everything is working well (you can select any page you want and the tree is display an behave as expected) except for check\_all() which is a jstree method as far as I can see  
10:47 <Enygma`> not sure how your selectors are written in the javascript for import, but from what I noticed in the create UI, there can be interference  
10:47 <Enygma`> specially since there are now multiple occurences of the same ID in the dom  
10:48 <mflorea> yes, you need to make sure the selector is specific enough  
10:48 <tmortagne> again the selction is not a import UI feature  
10:48 <Enygma`> since each tree uses IDs and if we display the same document in multiple trees, we end up with the same ID multiple times in the DOM  
10:48 <tmortagne> single selection works well  
10:48 <mflorea> I mean the selector used when you create the import tree  
10:49 <Enygma`> mflorea: multiple occurrances of the same ID is an issue though, IMO  
10:49 <mflorea> depends how you use those ID  
10:49 <Enygma`> I know you can be specific enough to avoid the problem, but from a validation pov, it`s not really ok  
10:50 <tmortagne> import UI does not select the tree using an id but using .xtree class  
10:50 <Enygma`> tmortagne: this.xtree = $.jstree.reference($('.xtree'));  
10:51 <Enygma`> that can return either the import tree or a tree from the breadcrumbs  
10:51 <Enygma`> stuff like that needs to be more specific, since now we have multiple xtree instances in the same page  
10:51 <Enygma`> this messed with the create tests as well  
10:52 <tmortagne> trying to change the selector  
10:53 <tmortagne> the things is the line above which is also based on class select the proper element  
10:53 <tmortagne> otherwise there would not be any select box in the tree  
10:53 <tmortagne> \*checkbox  
11:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <ClemensR> has quit  
11:18 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: the breadcrumb now triggers xwiki:dom:updated :)  
11:40 <mflorea> great, I'll update the tree navigation. Thanks!  
11:42 <Slashman> has quit  
11:44 <tmortagne> I guess the two failing test on document index are the same wrong tree issue  
11:45 <tmortagne> timing is similar and looks like the test is claiming that it can't find something  can see in the screenshot  
11:45 <tmortagne> (one node of the document index tree)  
11:46 <tmortagne> yep same thing  
11:46 <tmortagne>     @FindBy(className = "xtree")  
11:47 <tmortagne> and it's probably not the only one, looks like selecting by using xtree class is common, hope it did not break too many extensions  
12:32 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:45 <tmortagne> mflorea: various AWM test are failing because the id of the app name field changed from appName to appTitle, is this expected ?  
12:45 <tmortagne> (the name of the field is still appName, only the id changed)  
12:46 <mflorea> yes, expected, I need to update the page objects  
12:46 <mflorea> I'm fixing the class sheet test now  
12:46 <mflorea> I'll check the AWM tests afterwards  
12:47 <Slashman> has quit  
12:47 <gilesparnell> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <gilesparnell> has quit  
12:51 <tmortagne> mflorea: i'm on the PO already, just wanted to be sure it's expected  
12:53 <tmortagne> mflorea: I fixed several classsheet issue by the way  
12:53 <tmortagne> caused by the rename of some links  
12:53 <tmortagne> ("document" -> "page")  
13:17 <mflorea> tmortagne: have you committed the changes to the class sheet po? I don't have them locally  
13:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
13:19 <tmortagne> mflorea: it's up to date on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-xclass/xwiki-platform-xclass-test/xwiki-platform-xclass-test-pageobjects/src/main/java/org/xwiki/xclass/test/po/ClassSheetPage.java  
13:20 <tmortagne> my commit is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/d4c295a94a375b8e1e81104ed7e909dda6ac78b0#diff-89af25229dfaeda9771b59541d6effc8  
13:20 <mflorea> ok  
13:21 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <mflorea> ok, platform should be fine with my last commit  
13:28 <mflorea> moving to enterprise tests  
13:54 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:02 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:05 <Slashman> has quit  
15:06 <mflorea> I'm fixing the remaining AWM tests  
15:07 <mflorea> on platform, the class sheet test passes locally for me, I'll check again later if it continues to fail  
15:15 <Ramona1> has quit  
15:15 <vmassol> Pbas: thanks for filling the survey report :)  
15:15 <vmassol> s/report//  
15:16 <vmassol> actually not sure it was you, I tried to deduce who filled an entry of that survey but what the user said and it's matching stuff I've seen you say in the past but it could be someone else ;)  
15:16 <Pbas> hein? ... sleeping  
15:17 <vmassol> not you? :  
15:17 <vmassol> :)  
15:17 <Pbas> which survey?  
15:17 <vmassol> feature survey  
15:17 <vmassol> for 8.x  
15:17 <vmassol> so not you I guess  
15:17 <Pbas> mmm nope :-)  
15:17 <vmassol> 1/ A good forum for the community support (using XWiki ?), the mailing list is so 20th century!  
15:17 <vmassol> 2/ Capability to apply StyleSheet to an entire wiki without Programming Rights.  
15:17 <vmassol> thought it was you asking for 2/ :)  
15:18 <Pbas> ha yes  
15:18 <Pbas> I guess it is me but not sure anyways :-D  
15:18 <vmassol> hehe  
15:19 <vmassol> "In my opinion, the main weak point of XWiki is its difficulty to demonstrate, explain to end users, admins, developers all its capabilities." that's very true  
15:20 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:20 <Pbas> it must be an "old" answers then though  
15:21 <vmassol> maybe it's not you  
15:21 <vmassol> was filled yesterday  
15:21 <vmassol> anyway doesn't matter, just wante dto say thanks to whoever filled it :)  
15:21 <Pbas> ok then it is not mine ... but I agree with this opinioon  
15:22 <vmassol> if it's not you then you could also fill the survey  
15:22 <vmassol> would be nice :)  
15:22 <vmassol> see http://markmail.org/message/6y6b3sfws4hrncpi  
15:24 <Pbas> sure :-)  
15:29 <vmassol> thanks
